intro: Seseli tenellum, commonly known as the slender seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. It is often found in grasslands and along coastal areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the umbelliferous group.
